algorithms.name: DOM-Element-setHTMLUnsafe
algorithms.html: Element's setHTMLUnsafe(html, options) method steps are:

steps.html: Let compliantHTML be the result of invoking the Get Trusted Type compliant string algorithm with TrustedHTML, this's relevant global object, html, "Element setHTMLUnsafe", and "script".
Let target be this's template contents if this is a template element; otherwise this.
Set and filter HTML given target, this, compliantHTML, options, and false.

algorithms.name: DOM-Element-setHTML
algorithms.html: Element's setHTML(html, options) method steps are:

steps.html: Let target be this's template contents if this is a template; otherwise this.
Set and filter HTML given target, this, html, options, and true.

algorithms.name: ShadowRoot-setHTMLUnsafe
algorithms.html: ShadowRoot's setHTMLUnsafe(html, options) method steps are:

steps.html: Let compliantHTML be the result of invoking the Get Trusted Type compliant string algorithm with TrustedHTML, this's relevant global object, html, "ShadowRoot setHTMLUnsafe", and "script".
Set and filter HTML using this, this's shadow host (as context element), compliantHTML, options, and false.

algorithms.name: ShadowRoot-setHTML
algorithms.html: ShadowRoot's setHTML(html, options) method steps are:

steps.html: Set and filter HTML using this (as target), this (as context element), html, options, and true.

algorithms.name: parseHTMLUnsafe
algorithms.html: The <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-for="DOM/Document" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-export="" id="dom-document-parsehtmlunsafe①" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">parseHTMLUnsafe</dfn>(<var>html</var>, <var>options</var>) method steps are:

steps.html: Let compliantHTML be the result of invoking the Get Trusted Type compliant string algorithm with TrustedHTML, this's relevant global object, html, "Document parseHTMLUnsafe", and "script".
Let document be a new Document, whose content type is "text/html".
Set document’s allow declarative shadow roots to true.
Parse HTML from a string given document and compliantHTML.
Let config be the result of calling get a sanitizer config from options with options and false.
If config is not empty, then call sanitize on document’s root node with config.
Return document.

algorithms.name: parseHTML
algorithms.html: The <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-for="DOM/Document" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-export="" id="dom-document-parsehtml①" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">parseHTML</dfn>(<var>html</var>, <var>options</var>) method steps are:

steps.html: Let document be a new Document, whose content type is "text/html".
Set document’s allow declarative shadow roots to true.
Parse HTML from a string given document and html.
Let config be the result of calling get a sanitizer config from options with options and true.
Call sanitize on document’s root node with config.
Return document.

algorithms.name: Sanitizer/constructor
algorithms.html:
The <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-for="Sanitizer" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-export="" id="sanitizer-constructor" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">constructor</dfn>(<var>config</var>)
method steps are:

steps.html: Store config in this's internal slot.

algorithms.name: Sanitizer/get
algorithms.html: The <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-for="Sanitizer" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-export="" id="sanitizer-get" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">get</dfn>() method steps are:

steps.html: Return the result of canonicalize a configuration with the value of this's internal slot and true.

algorithms.name: Sanitizer/getUnsafe
algorithms.html: The <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-for="Sanitizer" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-export="" id="sanitizer-getunsafe" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">getUnsafe</dfn>() method steps are:

steps.html: Return the result of canonicalize a configuration with the value of this's internal slot and false.

algorithms.name: set and filter HTML
algorithms.html: To set and filter HTML, given an Element or DocumentFragment target, an Element contextElement, a string html, and a dictionary options, and a boolean safe:

steps.html: If safe and contextElement’s local name is "script" and contextElement’s namespace is the HTML namespace or the SVG namespace, then return.
Let config be the result of calling get a sanitizer config from options with options and safe.
Let newChildren be the result of the HTML fragment parsing algorithm steps given contextElement, html, and true.
Let fragment be a new DocumentFragment whose node document is contextElement’s node document.
For each node in newChildren, append node to fragment.
If config is not empty, then run sanitize on fragment using config.
Replace all with fragment within target.

algorithms.name: SanitizerConfig/get a sanitizer config from options
algorithms.html:
To <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-for="SanitizerConfig" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="sanitizerconfig-get-a-sanitizer-config-from-options" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">get a sanitizer config from options</dfn> for
an options dictionary <var>options</var> and a boolean <var>safe</var>, do:

steps.html: Assert: options is a dictionary.
If options["sanitizer"] doesn’t exist, then return undefined.
Assert: options["sanitizer"] is either a Sanitizer instance or a dictionary.

To <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-for="SanitizerConfig" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="sanitizerconfig-get-a-sanitizer-config-from-options" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">get a sanitizer config from options</dfn> for
an options dictionary <var>options</var> and a boolean <var>safe</var>, do:
Then let config be the value of options["sanitizer"]'s internal slot.
Otherwise let config be the value of options["sanitizer"].
Return the result of calling canonicalize a configuration on config and safe.

algorithms.name: sanitize
algorithms.html: For the main sanitize operation, using a ParentNode node, a canonical SanitizerConfig config, run these steps:

steps.html: Assert: config is canonical.
Let current be node.
For the main sanitize operation, using a ParentNode node, a canonical SanitizerConfig config, run these steps:
Assert: child implements Text, Comment, or Element.
For the main sanitize operation, using a ParentNode node, a canonical SanitizerConfig config, run these steps:
continue.
For the main sanitize operation, using a ParentNode node, a canonical SanitizerConfig config, run these steps:
For the main sanitize operation, using a ParentNode node, a canonical SanitizerConfig config, run these steps:
remove child.
For the main sanitize operation, using a ParentNode node, a canonical SanitizerConfig config, run these steps:
Let elementName be a SanitizerElementNamespace with child’s local name and namespace.
For the main sanitize operation, using a ParentNode node, a canonical SanitizerConfig config, run these steps:
remove child.
For the main sanitize operation, using a ParentNode node, a canonical SanitizerConfig config, run these steps:
remove child.
For the main sanitize operation, using a ParentNode node, a canonical SanitizerConfig config, run these steps:
Call sanitize on child with config.
Call replace all with child’s children within child.
If elementName equals «[ "name" → "template", "namespace" → HTML namespace ]»
ignored: Then call sanitize on child’s template contents with config.

steps.html: If child is a shadow host:
ignored: Then call sanitize on child’s shadow root with config.

steps.html: For the main sanitize operation, using a ParentNode node, a canonical SanitizerConfig config, run these steps:
Let attrName be a SanitizerAttributeNamespace with attr’s local name and namespace.
For the main sanitize operation, using a ParentNode node, a canonical SanitizerConfig config, run these steps:
For the main sanitize operation, using a ParentNode node, a canonical SanitizerConfig config, run these steps:
Remove attr from child.
For the main sanitize operation, using a ParentNode node, a canonical SanitizerConfig config, run these steps:
Remove attr from child.
For the main sanitize operation, using a ParentNode node, a canonical SanitizerConfig config, run these steps:
Remove attr from child.
For the main sanitize operation, using a ParentNode node, a canonical SanitizerConfig config, run these steps:
Remove attr from child.
If «[elementName, attrName]» matches an entry in the navigating URL attributes list, and if attr’s protocol is "javascript:":
Call sanitize on child’s shadow root with config.
For the main sanitize operation, using a ParentNode node, a canonical SanitizerConfig config, run these steps:
remove child.

algorithms.name: SanitizerConfig/valid
algorithms.html: A <var>config</var> is <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-for="SanitizerConfig" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="sanitizerconfig-valid" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">valid</dfn> if all these conditions are met:

steps.html: config is a dictionary
config’s key set does not contain both "elements" and "removeElements"
config’s key set does not contain both "removeAttributes" and "attributes".
For any key of «[ "elements", "removeElements", "replaceWithChildrenElements", "attributes", "removeAttributes" ]» where config[key] exists:

A <var>config</var> is <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-for="SanitizerConfig" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="sanitizerconfig-valid" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">valid</dfn> if all these conditions are met:
element does not contain both "attributes" and "removeAttributes".
If either element["attributes"] or element["removeAttributes"] exists, then it is valid.

A <var>config</var> is <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-for="SanitizerConfig" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="sanitizerconfig-valid" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">valid</dfn> if all these conditions are met:
Let tmpattrs be tmp["attributes"] if it exists, and otherwise built-in default config["attributes"].

A <var>config</var> is <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-for="SanitizerConfig" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="sanitizerconfig-valid" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">valid</dfn> if all these conditions are met:
If either item["attributes"] or item["removeAttributes"] exists:
ignored: Then the difference between it and tmpattrs is empty.

Given theses canonicalized name lists, all of the following conditions hold: The intersection between tmp["elements"] and tmp["removeElements"] is empty. The intersection between tmp["removeElements"] tmp["replaceWithChildrenElements"] is empty. The intersection between tmp["replaceWithChildrenElements"] and tmp["elements"] is empty. The intersection between tmp["attributes"] and tmp["removeAttributes"] is empty.

algorithms.name: SanitizerNameList/valid
algorithms.html:
A <var>list</var> of names is <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-for="SanitizerNameList" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="sanitizernamelist-valid" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">valid</dfn> if all these
conditions are met:

steps.html: list is a list.

A <var>list</var> of names is <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-for="SanitizerNameList" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="sanitizernamelist-valid" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">valid</dfn> if all these
conditions are met:
name is a string or a dictionary.
If name is a dictionary:
ignored: name["name"] exists and is a string.

algorithms.name: SanitizerConfig/canonical
algorithms.html: A <var>config</var> is <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-for="SanitizerConfig" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="sanitizerconfig-canonical" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">canonical</dfn> if all these conditions are met:

steps.html: config is valid.
config’s key set is a subset of «[ "elements", "removeElements", "replaceWithChildrenElements", "attributes", "removeAttributes", "comments", "dataAttributes" ]»
config’s key set contains either:
ignored: both "elements" and "attributes", but neither of "removeElements" or "removeAttributes". or both "removeElements" and "removeAttributes", but neither of "elements" or "attributes".

steps.html: For any key of «[ "replaceWithChildrenElements", "removeElements", "attributes", "removeAttributes" ]» where config[key] exists:
If config["elements"] exists:

A <var>config</var> is <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-for="SanitizerConfig" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="sanitizerconfig-canonical" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">canonical</dfn> if all these conditions are met:
if config[key] exists, config[key] is a boolean.

algorithms.name: SanitizerNameList/canonical
algorithms.html:
A <var>list</var> of names is <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-for="SanitizerNameList" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="sanitizernamelist-canonical" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">canonical</dfn> if all these
conditions are met:

steps.html: list[key] is a list.
For all of its list[key]'s members name:
ignored: name is a dictionary. name’s key set equals «[ "name", "namespace" ]» name’s values are strings.

algorithms.name: SanitizerNameWithAttributesList/canonical
algorithms.html: A <var>list</var> of names is <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-for="SanitizerNameWithAttributesList" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="sanitizernamewithattributeslist-canonical" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">canonical</dfn> if all these conditions are met:

steps.html: list[key] is a list.
For all of its list[key]'s members name:
ignored: name is a dictionary. name’s key set equals one of: «[ "name", "namespace" ]» «[ "name", "namespace", "attributes" ]» «[ "name", "namespace", "removeAttributes" ]» name["name"] and name["namespace"] are strings. name["attributes"] and name["removeAttributes"] are canonical if they exist.

algorithms.name: canonicalize a configuration
algorithms.html: To canonicalize a configuration config with a boolean safe:

steps.html: Assert: built-in default config is canonical.
Assert: built-in default config["elements"] is a subset of known elements.
Assert: built-in default config["attributes"] is a subset of known attributes.
Assert: «[ "elements" → known elements, "attributes" → known attributes, ]» is canonical.
If config is empty and not safe, then return «[]»
If config is not valid, then throw a TypeError.
Let result be a new dictionary.
To canonicalize a configuration config with a boolean safe:
If config[key] exists, set result[key] to the result of running canonicalize a sanitizer element list on config[key] with HTML namespace as the default namespace.
To canonicalize a configuration config with a boolean safe:
If config[key] exists, set result[key] to the result of running canonicalize a sanitizer element list on config[key] with null as the default namespace.
Set result["comments"] to config["comments"].
Let default be the result of canonicalizing a configuration for the built-in default config.
To canonicalize a configuration config with a boolean safe:
To canonicalize a configuration config with a boolean safe:
Let elementBlockList be the difference between known elements default["elements"].
Set result["elements"] to the difference of result["elements"] and elementBlockList.
To canonicalize a configuration config with a boolean safe:
Set result["elements"] to the difference of default["elements"] and result["removeElements"].
Remove "removeElements" from result.
To canonicalize a configuration config with a boolean safe:
Set result["elements"] to default["elements"].
To canonicalize a configuration config with a boolean safe:
Let attributeBlockList be the difference between known attributes and default["attributes"];
Set result["attributes"] to the difference of result["attributes"] and attributeBlockList.
To canonicalize a configuration config with a boolean safe:
Set result["attributes"] to the difference of default["attributes"] and result["removeAttributes"].
Remove "removeAttributes" from result.
To canonicalize a configuration config with a boolean safe:
Set result["attributes"] to default["attributes"].
To canonicalize a configuration config with a boolean safe:
To canonicalize a configuration config with a boolean safe:
Set result["elements"] to default["elements"].
To canonicalize a configuration config with a boolean safe:
Set result["attributes"] to default["attributes"].
Assert: result is valid.
Assert: result is canonical.
Return result.

algorithms.name: canonicalize a sanitizer element list
algorithms.html:
In order to <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="canonicalize-a-sanitizer-element-list" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">canonicalize a sanitizer element list</dfn> <var>list</var>, with a
default namespace <var>defaultNamespace</var>, run the following steps:

steps.html: Let result be a new ordered set.
For each name in list, call canonicalize a sanitizer name on name with defaultNamespace and append to result.
Return result.

algorithms.name: canonicalize a sanitizer name
algorithms.html:
In order to <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="canonicalize-a-sanitizer-name" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">canonicalize a sanitizer name</dfn> <var>name</var>, with a default
namespace <var>defaultNamespace</var>, run the following steps:

steps.html: Assert: name is either a DOMString or a dictionary.
If name is a DOMString, then return «[ "name" → name, "namespace" → defaultNamespace]».
Assert: name is a dictionary and name["name"] exists.

Return «[
"name" → name["name"],
"namespace" → name["namespace"] if it exists, otherwise defaultNamespace
]».

algorithms.name: set/difference
algorithms.html: Set difference (or set subtraction) is a clone of a set A, but with all members removed that occur in a set B: To compute the difference of two ordered sets A and B:

steps.html: Let set be a new ordered set.
Set difference (or set subtraction) is a clone of a set A, but with all members removed that occur in a set B: To compute the difference of two ordered sets A and B:
If B does not contain item, then append item to set.
Return set.
